Playing MR2 on PS3
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2012 Topics: Playing MR2 on PS3
By purehatred89 on Sunday, June 17, 2012 - 07:18 am:

Does anybody here play MR2 on the PS3? I'd like to
know what discs can be read and generate monsters.
PSOne, music and PC-CDs obviously, but what about
PS3 games and DVDs? Blu-Rays? I'm assuming PS2 games
won't read on the newer models of PS3.

Thanks in advance!

By purehatred89 on Sunday, June 17, 2012 - 03:32 pm:

Just thought I should add, the reason I'm asking
instead of testing myself is that I'm waiting on my
copy of the game in the mail, figured I;d find out
beforehand!

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, June 17, 2012 - 04:05 pm:

When PS3 was new, users reported being able to use PC and Mac discs as well as DVDs. I don't know about Blu-Ray.

By purehatred89 on Sunday, June 17, 2012 - 04:53 pm:

Great, thanks Lisa! :)

By purehatred89 on Monday, June 18, 2012 - 08:13 am:

Game arrived and I tested.

All DVDs and Blu-Rays (PS2 games, PS3 games and
any PC games printed on DVD ROM included)
generated a Hachiro [Zuum/Baku].

All Xbox games produced either a Gaboo, a Melon
Suezo [Suezo/Zuum], or a locked monster (None
unlocked), which I'm assuming is probably all the
same too.

Shame, I had literally hundreds of DVD discs too
:/

By Lisa Shock on Monday, June 18, 2012 - 10:31 am:

That's too bad, can you post the model number of your machine, please?

By purehatred89 on Monday, June 18, 2012 - 01:12 pm:

CECH-2003A, it's a PAL.

Hope this helps with any research you have :)

By fiffa46 on Wednesday, June 20, 2012 - 06:57 am:

I was under the impression that the disc generation was limited to the technology of the original system the game was designed for. As an example I recall the PSOne MR's would always generate a generic "can't read this disc" monster if you used a DvD as the PSOne could not read DvD's. However, as far as PC games go I have found the following to be the case. If the disc has install information on it you get a generic. If it only has "play" information on it then it would generate a different monster. I doubt any of the current monster ranchers can read Blu-Rays as anything other then giving a generic monster. I hope this helps you.

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, June 20, 2012 - 10:31 am:

GM posted here, in 2008:

Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2008 Topics: (Year We Visited the Town): Monster Regeneration on PS3

His unit was an NTSC one, obviously an older model.

By fiffa46 on Wednesday, June 20, 2012 - 11:53 am:

Very interesting. I remember when the PS2 came out even though it could read DvD's PSOne MR titles still could not read them and would generate a generic monster. I have an old 60 gig PS3 and naturally all of my MR discs so I suppose I will have to try this out with the 3 blu-ray discs I have.

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, June 21, 2012 - 09:19 am:

I'd be interested to see the results of that experiment.

By fiffa46 on Thursday, June 21, 2012 - 12:04 pm:

Well no good, my MR2 disc starts up, even lets me check the memory cards (and I have saved data on my ps3 for this game) but it won't let me get past the "now loading" screen. I even tried New Game and same result. For the heck of it I checked out some discs on MR1 and MR3 and got some interesting results if you are interested in them.

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, June 21, 2012 - 11:01 pm:

Yeah, go ahead. I've been contemplating new rules for the CD lists, like maybe letting people post there, just please state that it was on a PS3.

By fiffa46 on Friday, June 22, 2012 - 08:29 pm:

Ok well I checked 3 PS3 games (blu-ray), 1 movie (blu-ray) and 3 DvD's from a PC game (the third is just a bonus disc with no instalation data on it).

For MR3 I got the following results.
All 4 Blu-ray discs gave me the generic Mocchi.
The 2 PC DvD's with installation information gave a Tortboy (mew) but with different stats. The other DvD gave a Naga.
For MR1 ALL of the discs gave a Dino. The strange thing is that although they all gave a generic monster the stats were widely different from each disc.

By Lisa Shock on Friday, June 22, 2012 - 08:45 pm:

Hmm, that's interesting. In MR1, IIRC the default monster for single track (most PC discs) is worm.

By VenomousX on Saturday, June 23, 2012 - 04:26 pm:

I tried some ps3 games with my monster rancher 2 but got the "Too rare" message, and I can't be bothered to unlock all the breeds again right now.. But if anyone has a working copy of MR2 and these ps3 games and wants to test it out on the ps3 go ahead.

The games are:
3d dot game heroes
dragon age

By qolf on Sunday, January 27, 2013 - 04:03 pm:

I too play Monster Rancher 2 on my PS3. I tried
about 10 Ps3 Games. The results were 5 Hachiros,2
Gaboos, and 1 Scaled Plant. I also just experimented
to see what CD's gave me. All the Cd's i tried gave
me the same exact monster as on the ps1,figured.I
just stick to using plain cd's like before.
